trans-unit.source: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

seg-source.mrk: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

target.mrk: The handle of a file, as returned by a previous call to FileOpen().

trans-unit.source: The offset to move from the origin. This value may be positive or negative. Negative values move backwards from the origin.

seg-source.mrk: The offset to move from the origin.
This value may be positive or negative.
Negative values move backwards from the origin.

target.mrk: The offset to move from the origin.
This value may be positive or negative.
Negative values move backwards from the origin.

trans-unit.source: Must be one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: Must be one of the following:

target.mrk: Must be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Include Constants.au3 in your script to use the symbolic name in parentheses to specify the origin.

seg-source.mrk: Include Constants.au3 in your script to use the symbolic name in parentheses to specify the origin.

target.mrk: Include Constants.au3 in your script to use the symbolic name in parentheses to specify the origin.

trans-unit.source: Using FileSetPos() it is possible to both read and write to the same file. When attempting to read and write to the same file, always call FileFlush() between each write and read operation.

seg-source.mrk: Using FileSetPos() it is possible to both read and write to the same file.
When attempting to read and write to the same file, always call FileFlush() between each write and read operation.

target.mrk: Using FileSetPos() it is possible to both read and write to the same file.
When attempting to read and write to the same file, always call FileFlush() between each write and read operation.

trans-unit.source: Moving the pointer to the middle of the data can be used to overwrite data.

seg-source.mrk: Moving the pointer to the middle of the data can be used to overwrite data.

target.mrk: Moving the pointer to the middle of the data can be used to overwrite data.

trans-unit.source: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the filepath that will be read/written to.

seg-source.mrk: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the filepath that will be read/written to.

target.mrk: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the filepath that will be read/written to.

trans-unit.source: Open the file for writing (overwrite the file) and store the handle to a variable.

seg-source.mrk: Open the file for writing (overwrite the file) and store the handle to a variable.

target.mrk: Open the file for writing (overwrite the file) and store the handle to a variable.

trans-unit.source: An error occurred whilst writing the temporary file.

seg-source.mrk: An error occurred whilst writing the temporary file.

target.mrk: An error occurred whilst writing the temporary file.

trans-unit.source: Write data to the file using the handle returned by FileOpen.

trans-unit.source: Check file position and try to read contents for current position.

trans-unit.source: Now, adjust the position to the beginning.

trans-unit.source: Close the handle returned by FileOpen.
